anomalies.message: [ESCALATE] The written‐amount field is missing, creating an amount‐mismatch risk, and although the ensemble score is 0%, the base models flag elevated risk. Manual review is recommended.

ai_analysis.summary: The written‐amount field is missing, creating an amount‐mismatch risk, and although the ensemble score is 0%, the base models flag elevated risk. Manual review is recommended.
reasoning: Extracted written amount is “Unknown,” so we cannot confirm that the written and numeric amounts match. Training data shows 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches.
The Random Forest (78%) and XGBoost (73.4%) individual scores are both above 70%, indicating moderate risk signals that the ensemble may have under-weighed.
New customer with no prior history—lack of previous safe transaction history raises caution.
No similar past cases to compare, increasing uncertainty.
Signature is present, so no mandatory-reject on signature grounds.
actionable_recommendations: Ask the issuer or customer to provide the written-amount field or a clear copy showing the written amount.
Call Western Union to validate the serial number and issuance details.
Request government-issued ID from both purchaser (John Doe) and payee (Jane Smith) and compare signatures.
